parameters.description: Settings for automatic tax lookup for this invoice preview.
parameters.name: automatic_tax

parameters.description: The ID of the coupon to apply to this phase of the subscription schedule. This field has been deprecated and will be removed in a future API version. Use `discounts` instead.
parameters.name: coupon

parameters.description: The currency to preview this invoice in. Defaults to that of `customer` if not specified.
parameters.name: currency

parameters.description: The identifier of the customer whose upcoming invoice you'd like to retrieve. If `automatic_tax` is enabled then one of `customer`, `customer_details`, `subscription`, or `schedule` must be set.
parameters.name: customer

parameters.description: Details about the customer you want to invoice or overrides for an existing customer. If `automatic_tax` is enabled then one of `customer`, `customer_details`, `subscription`, or `schedule` must be set.
parameters.name: customer_details

parameters.description: The coupons to redeem into discounts for the invoice preview. If not specified, inherits the discount from the subscription or customer. This works for both coupons directly applied to an invoice and coupons applied to a subscription. Pass an empty string to avoid inheriting any discounts.
parameters.name: discounts

parameters.description: Specifies which fields in the response should be expanded.
parameters.name: expand

parameters.description: List of invoice items to add or update in the upcoming invoice preview (up to 250).
parameters.name: invoice_items

parameters.description: The connected account that issues the invoice. The invoice is presented with the branding and support information of the specified account.
parameters.name: issuer

parameters.description: The account (if any) for which the funds of the invoice payment are intended. If set, the invoice will be presented with the branding and support information of the specified account. See the [Invoices with Connect](https://stripe.com/docs/billing/invoices/connect) documentation for details.
parameters.name: on_behalf_of

parameters.description: Customizes the types of values to include when calculating the invoice. Defaults to `next` if unspecified.
parameters.name: preview_mode

parameters.description: The identifier of the schedule whose upcoming invoice you'd like to retrieve. Cannot be used with subscription or subscription fields.
parameters.name: schedule

parameters.description: The schedule creation or modification params to apply as a preview. Cannot be used with `subscription` or `subscription_` prefixed fields.
parameters.name: schedule_details

parameters.description: The identifier of the subscription for which you'd like to retrieve the upcoming invoice. If not provided, but a `subscription_details.items` is provided, you will preview creating a subscription with those items. If neither `subscription` nor `subscription_details.items` is provided, you will retrieve the next upcoming invoice from among the customer's subscriptions.
parameters.name: subscription

parameters.description: For new subscriptions, a future timestamp to anchor the subscription's [billing cycle](https://stripe.com/docs/subscriptions/billing-cycle). This is used to determine the date of the first full invoice, and, for plans with `month` or `year` intervals, the day of the month for subsequent invoices. For existing subscriptions, the value can only be set to `now` or `unchanged`. This field has been deprecated and will be removed in a future API version. Use `subscription_details.billing_cycle_anchor` instead.
parameters.name: subscription_billing_cycle_anchor

parameters.description: A timestamp at which the subscription should cancel. If set to a date before the current period ends, this will cause a proration if prorations have been enabled using `proration_behavior`. If set during a future period, this will always cause a proration for that period. This field has been deprecated and will be removed in a future API version. Use `subscription_details.cancel_at` instead.
parameters.name: subscription_cancel_at

parameters.description: Indicate whether this subscription should cancel at the end of the current period (`current_period_end`). Defaults to `false`. This field has been deprecated and will be removed in a future API version. Use `subscription_details.cancel_at_period_end` instead.
parameters.name: subscription_cancel_at_period_end

parameters.description: This simulates the subscription being canceled or expired immediately. This field has been deprecated and will be removed in a future API version. Use `subscription_details.cancel_now` instead.
parameters.name: subscription_cancel_now

parameters.description: If provided, the invoice returned will preview updating or creating a subscription with these default tax rates. The default tax rates will apply to any line item that does not have `tax_rates` set. This field has been deprecated and will be removed in a future API version. Use `subscription_details.default_tax_rates` instead.
parameters.name: subscription_default_tax_rates

parameters.description: The subscription creation or modification params to apply as a preview. Cannot be used with `schedule` or `schedule_details` fields.
parameters.name: subscription_details

parameters.description: A list of up to 20 subscription items, each with an attached price. This field has been deprecated and will be removed in a future API version. Use `subscription_details.items` instead.
parameters.name: subscription_items

parameters.description: Determines how to handle [prorations](https://stripe.com/docs/billing/subscriptions/prorations) when the billing cycle changes (e.g., when switching plans, resetting `billing_cycle_anchor=now`, or starting a trial), or if an item's `quantity` changes. The default value is `create_prorations`. This field has been deprecated and will be removed in a future API version. Use `subscription_details.proration_behavior` instead.
parameters.name: subscription_proration_behavior

parameters.description: If previewing an update to a subscription, and doing proration, `subscription_proration_date` forces the proration to be calculated as though the update was done at the specified time. The time given must be within the current subscription period and within the current phase of the schedule backing this subscription, if the schedule exists. If set, `subscription`, and one of `subscription_items`, or `subscription_trial_end` are required. Also, `subscription_proration_behavior` cannot be set to 'none'. This field has been deprecated and will be removed in a future API version. Use `subscription_details.proration_date` instead.
parameters.name: subscription_proration_date

parameters.description: For paused subscriptions, setting `subscription_resume_at` to `now` will preview the invoice that will be generated if the subscription is resumed. This field has been deprecated and will be removed in a future API version. Use `subscription_details.resume_at` instead.
parameters.name: subscription_resume_at

parameters.description: Date a subscription is intended to start (can be future or past). This field has been deprecated and will be removed in a future API version. Use `subscription_details.start_date` instead.
parameters.name: subscription_start_date

parameters.description: If provided, the invoice returned will preview updating or creating a subscription with that trial end. If set, one of `subscription_items` or `subscription` is required. This field has been deprecated and will be removed in a future API version. Use `subscription_details.trial_end` instead.
parameters.name: subscription_trial_end

schema.description: An error response from the Stripe API
